meanings.definition: Gruelings (noun): a plural form of the word 'grueling', meaning a difficult or demanding task or experience.
meanings.sent1: The students faced many gruelings in their final exams.
meanings.sent2: Completing a marathon is a true test of gruelings.
meanings.sent3: The gruelings of solving a challenging puzzle can be quite satisfying.
meanings.sent4: Facing the gruelings of life head-on builds character.
meanings.sent5: The gruelings of climbing a steep mountain can be both exhausting and exhilarating.

meanings.definition: Gruelings (adjective): a plural form of the word 'grueling', meaning extremely tiring or exhausting.
meanings.sent1: After the long hike, they felt gruelings in their legs.
meanings.sent2: The gruelings workout left her feeling accomplished.
meanings.sent3: The gruelings journey through the forest was worth the effort.
meanings.sent4: The gruelings task of cleaning the entire house seemed never-ending.
meanings.sent5: The gruelings day at work made him appreciate his restful weekends even more.
